```{python}
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
```

```{python}
tweets = (
    pd
    .read_parquet('datasets/tweets.par')
    # .assign(
    #     local_time=lambda d: pd.to_datetime(d.local_time),
    #     user_screen_name = lambda df: df.user_screen_name.astype('category')
    # )
)
```

```{python}
tweets_day = (
    tweets
    .reset_index()
    .assign(
        date= lambda df: df.local_time.dt.date
    )
    .groupby(['user_screen_name', 'date'])
        [['id']]
        .count()
        .rename(columns={'id':'tweets per day'})
    #.reset_index()
)
```

```{python}
table = (
    tweets_day
    .groupby(['user_screen_name'])
        .agg(['mean', 'std', 'min', 'max'])
)

table
```

```{python}
print(table.to_markdown())
```

```{python}
fig, ax = plt.subplots()

fig.set_size_inches(15, 10)



(
    tweets_day
    .reset_index()
    .plot
        .scatter(
            x='date',
            y='tweets per day',
            c='user_screen_name',
            s=10,
            cmap='Accent',
            colorbar=False,
            alpha=0.2,
            ax=ax
        )
)

(
    tweets_day
    .pivot_table(
        index='date',
        columns='user_screen_name',
        values='tweets per day'
    )
    .rolling(7)
    .mean()
    .plot
        .line(
            ax=ax,
            cmap='Accent'
            #logy=True
        )
)

plt.savefig('graphics/tweets_day.png')

plt.show()
```
